channel.title: Comments on: Why Isn’t AWS in Canada?

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2015/12/11/why-isnt-aws-in-canada/#comment-4409">Daniel Howard</a>.
No doubt. That doesn't help the large number of companies that are deeply tied to AWS. In those cases the only places they have local servers is where AWS DCs are located.

item.title: By: Daniel Howard
item.dc:creator: Daniel Howard
item.description: I like to think Canada has cloud hosting options beyond AWS. Maybe Amazon just doesn't want to pay taxes.
item.content:encoded: I like to think Canada has cloud hosting options beyond AWS. Maybe Amazon just doesn’t want to pay taxes.

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2015/12/11/why-isnt-aws-in-canada/#comment-4407">Matt Wiebe</a>.
That would not surprise me, and a feeling that is likely shared by many in other countries as well.
Unfortunately that is a problem that simply won't scale. A startup ( and even most large companies ) can't possibly hope to keep data local in each country to avoid the potential problems of storage in one particular country ( the US in this case ).

item.title: By: Matt Wiebe
item.dc:creator: Matt Wiebe
item.description: Anecdotally, I know many Canadians who refuse to use AWS because they don't want their data subject to US laws and/or the NSA's snooping (legal or otherwise).
